title: Why did paradise play a game as ADC?
body: Why did paradise play a game as ADC?

replies.body:
Froskurinn here - caster of the OPL and LPL! 

Chenyboy is the ADC for AV, but was unable to play the first game of the series. AV's registered roster, including subs: DDD, Paradise, Chelby, Triple, Chenyboy, and Jakey.

The team made the decision that since playing with a sub anyway, it was better to keep DDD in the top position - my speculation is that he was more comfortable with his native position and since he's the newest member of the team that his focus should be just about meshing with the team and not meshing with the team AND an off role.

So because DDD was the acting top laner, Paradise stepped up and covered the position until Chenyboy was able to play the second game in which AV swapped their roster back to standard.

I hope this answers your questions.

This was posted on the Esports Board because I am asking a question about a professional player. Paradise is the top laner for Avant Garde in  the OPL, I started watching mid way through game 1 and he was playing adc and some random is playing top, in game 2 he is playing as top and Avant Gardes Adc chennyboy is back playing as ADC. 

Next time you see a question posted I hope your pre-frontal cortex has enough neurons firing so that you can pay attention to where that question is posted and what its about.

i know exactly where you posted it, I'm just laughing at your inability to understand that he isn't bound by law to play the exact same position every game of his life, Faker is known as a mid laner, yet he has played other positions before.

so he played a game as ADC, why should that even warrant a question? he's allowed.
Yes, he is allowed to. I am not saying he isn't. My question is why in a professional match is he not playing  his usual role...
